page.title: 14HOUSING IN HADFIELD 1
page.content: A walk through Hadfield showed a variety of housing to pupils of class 2M of St Andrews School, Hadfield. The first part of the walk was through the housing estate where most of the houses were made of brick. The new houses were built about 1965. They were mainly terraced houses. They had little ginnels between the houses. The roofs were of slate. Some houses had gardens at the front and back. Some others only had back gardens. Others had little walls with privets behind them. Most houses were terraced houses because instead of having twelve walls there would only be seven walls which saved time, work and bricks. You can have one wall for the side of two houses. We saw a lot of open space and in one of the open spaces we saw St Charles Church which is quite old.
